headline: How Chipotle & Lululemon are showing a shift in consumer spending
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast. In this episode of Stocks in Translation, Computer Trading Corporation CEO and President Peter Borish joins host Jared Blikre and Senior Reporter Allie Canal to discuss market divergences and how it is impacting consumers. Borish shares that consumer spending habits are shifting which is evident in brands like Chipotle (CMG) and Lululemon (LULU) showing signs of decline. As essentials like energy and bills continue to climb in cost, there is less room in consumer budgets for these companies and others of similar stature. Check out the full episode here. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff
